name: Rishabh Vatsa
about: Knowledge of Python, MySQL, Machine Learning and Data Analytics with a Bachelor of Technology - BTech focused in Instrumentation and Control from Dr. B R Ambedkar National Institute of Technology, Jalandhar.

experience.title: Data Scientist
experience.description: Risk Model for Device Intelligence: Developed and continuously upgraded a risk model to identify risky devices for a Device Intelligence product. This model helps companies assess users at any stage of the funnel, enhancing platform security and decision-making.Embeddings PoC: Contributing as an individual contributor under senior data leadership, conducting a Proof of Concept to validate the InternViT image encoder model. The project combines image and text embeddings to generate generic embeddings, which aid in evaluating user behavior across various funnel stages, helping companies make informed decisions. Used advanced clustering and visualisation techniques such as PCA, t-SNE, and UMAP for validation.Open Source LLM Implementation: Led the setup and integration of open-source LLMs, including LLaMa, Wizard-ML, and bart-large-mnli models, into products. This improved classification tasks and enhanced the intelligence layer for real-time processing in 'Digital Footprint.'Data-Centric Workflow: Focused 80% of time on working with complex datasets, performing feature engineering, data exploration, and generating insights that drive business problem-solving and model development.Azure Data Pipelines: Set up experimental and validation data pipelines between Azure, VMs, and local storage environments for seamless data flow in various projects.Leadership and Innovation: Managed a team of four and successfully executed over 30 PoCs, showcasing innovative data-driven solutions for clients, enhancing product features and decision-making.
experience.description_html: Risk Model for Device Intelligence: Developed and continuously upgraded a risk model to identify risky devices for a Device Intelligence product. This model helps companies assess users at any stage of the funnel, enhancing platform security and decision-making.Embeddings PoC: Contributing as an individual contributor under senior data leadership, conducting a Proof of Concept to validate the InternViT image encoder model. The project combines image and text embeddings to generate generic embeddings, which aid in evaluating user behavior across various funnel stages, helping companies make informed decisions. Used advanced clustering and visualisation techniques such as PCA, t-SNE, and UMAP for validation.Open Source LLM Implementation: Led the setup and integration of open-source LLMs, including LLaMa, Wizard-ML, and bart-large-mnli models, into products. This improved classification tasks and enhanced the intelligence layer for real-time processing in 'Digital Footprint.'Data-Centric Workflow: Focused 80% of time on working with complex datasets, performing feature engineering, data exploration, and generating insights that drive business problem-solving and model development.Azure Data Pipelines: Set up experimental and validation data pipelines between Azure, VMs, and local storage environments for seamless data flow in various projects.Leadership and Innovation: Managed a team of four and successfully executed over 30 PoCs, showcasing innovative data-driven solutions for clients, enhancing product features and decision-making.

projects.title: Multiple Objects Tracking on Aerial Images
projects.description: â€¢ Implemented Detection based trackers, where worked on centroid tracker and Deep SORT tracker with YOLOv4 as detection model trained on PASCAL datasetsâ€¢ Used SiamMask, a semi-supervised state-of-the-art technique as a detection-less tracker, first to draw the bounding box around the object from user Input and segment the video Stream around that bounding box, and track the segmented part in successive framesâ€¢ extended the tracking of multiple objects in a frame using SiamMask

projects.title: Application of Face Recognition in Robotics
projects.description: â€¢ Constructed a Face recognition system by using HOG Algorithm as face identification Algorithm which identify people by creating gradient array from the face by concealing different sides of faces â€¢ Used Pyserial library to establish communication between Arduino and the computer system to respond to the circuitry from the output of the system in form output displayed at LCD Display â€¢ Used pttsx and Datetime library to bring out voice output for greeting identified face by system at the specified time and synchronized the output of voice when more than two faces are identified
